page.title: 10BEXLEYHEATH SHOPPING CENTRE
page.content: Bexleyheath has become a major shopping area, with the opening of the Broadway Centre. It was opened on 13.3.'84 by H.R.H. The Duke of Edinburgh, and is owned jointly by the London Borough of Bexley and Norwich Union Insurance. The architectural style is modern, a long four storey building of concrete, brick and glass, with hanging tile facing. Inside, the walls are ashlard marble, and the ceilings have a bronzed effect. In the Mall is a squre where people can sit, surrounded by potted plants and small fountains. This area is frequently used for display purposes.
